an1.287-295:4.1: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen that an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result could come from good bodily conduct.
an1.287-295:4.3: But it is possible that a likable, desirable, agreeable result could come from good bodily conduct.
an1.287-295:6.1: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen that an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result could come from good verbal or mental conduct.
an1.287-295:6.3: But it is possible that a likable, desirable, agreeable result could come from good verbal or mental conduct.
an1.287-295:8.1: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen that someone who has engaged in bad bodily conduct, could for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
an1.287-295:8.3: But it is possible that someone who has engaged in bad bodily conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
an1.287-295:10.1: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen that someone who has angaged in bad verbal or mental conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
an1.287-295:10.3: But it is possible that someone who has angaged in bad verbal or mental conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
an1.287-295:12.1: It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen that someone who has engaged in good bodily conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, the underworld, a lower realm, hell.
an1.287-295:12.3: But it is possible that someone who has engaged in good bodily conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
an1.287-295:14.1: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen that someone who has engaged in good verbal or mental conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
an1.287-295:14.3: But it is possible that someone who has engaged in good verbal or mental conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, heavenly realm.
